alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 2:53PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Bell, Knox and central Whitley Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 252 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Redbird to Suttons Mill to Louden to Gausdale to Birdseye. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Birdseye, Perkins, Gausdale, Louden, Goins, Carpenter, Siler and Frakes around 255 PM EDT. Clate, Permon, Bryants Store and Wheeler around 300 PM EDT. Swan Lake, King, Hubbs and Kayjay around 305 PM EDT. Myrick, Swanpond and Trosper around 310 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Indian Creek, Avis, Dishman Springs, Brush Creek, Rockholds, Artemus, Faber, Barbourville, Heidrick, Himyar, Old Flat Lick, Flat Lick, Boone Heights, Baughman, Arkle, Fourmile, Lowell, Emmanuel, Bentley Station, Cannon, Wilton, Yeager, Bimble, Woodbine, Garrich, Barton, Dewitt, Hinkle, Girdler, Walker, Baileys Switch, Jarvis, Barnyard, Green Road, Moore Hill and Gray. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential downpours are also occurring with this storm and may lead to ponding of water on roadways or localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
